channel.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
channel.description:
Overloadx base - PI
I have been searching for this for a while now and can't seem to find it. I read soemwhere that you can change it in client.java under like [code]public void clanSendMessage[/code] , however, I do not have this specific void.
I have a fully functioning clan chat as well so it isn't that. i wish to change the color of the clan chat from green to a different color. I have also used a z file searcher and done a complete search for @gr2@ and @gre@ and just gr
nothing came up that related to the clan chat.

item.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
item.dc:creator: @mikeyboy09 mikeyboy09
item.description:
@mikeyboy09 wrote:

I shall take a look around the client files, if your not using the updated text engine then @red@ should work, just trying to remember what file <col is in

  • Mikey

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“jaspertjeoo, post:7, topic:391423”]i think its server sided (o_(-(^^)_*)_0)[/quote]Just not possible…I have it set to @red@ and yet it still shows green text. Only way that could happen is via the client.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“mikeyboy09, post:4, topic:391423”]With my PI when I use @gre@ it shows up as @gre@, stays the same.

So I did a little research and it turns out some PI clients have an updated text engine (most PI clients)
in other words things like @gre@ are replaced by what looks like html (in my eyes that is )
So it would be like <col=(number)>blahblahblah

  • Mikey [/quote]Okay well I ripped the old clanchathandler.java and clan.java and integrated just in case( and fixed the clan chat bug xD) yet it still shows the text as green. This leads me to believe it is client sided.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
item.dc:creator: @mikeyboy09 mikeyboy09
item.description:
@mikeyboy09 wrote:

With my PI when I use @gre@ it shows up as @gre@, stays the same.

So I did a little research and it turns out some PI clients have an updated text engine (most PI clients)
in other words things like @gre@ are replaced by what looks like html (in my eyes that is )
So it would be like <col=(number)>blahblahblah

  • Mikey

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Clan Chat Text Color
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

This is only thing I am seeing in the playerhandler even about text/chat

boolean saveChatTextUpdate = plr.isChatTextUpdateRequired(); plr.setChatTextUpdateRequired(false); plr.appendPlayerUpdateBlock(updateBlock); plr.setChatTextUpdateRequired(saveChatTextUpdate); str.writeBits(8, plr.playerListSize); int size = plr.playerListSize; if (size > 255) size = 255;

What is irritating to me, is that I have searched ALL files on the server and client side both and the text is green of some sort yet I cannot find anything with a “gr” to show for it.

Read full topic
